content.description: Steep face with enough edges and pockets to test ones finger strength.
content.location: Slightly around the corner, right of Spindrift.

content.description: Follow the crack to an overhanging face and some fun moves to the anchor.
Climb up the short pocketed face for 2 bolts then through the weakness of the bulge which will deposit you onto a technical slab with a few no hands moves to the chains.
content.location: When entering the 1st alcove, this route can be seen on the bottom of the right buttress. Look for the smooth face with just enough scattered pockets for the grade.

content.description: Climb up the face right of the arete through some powerful moves and finish short of the top of the cliff at a random chain anchor.
content.location: Uphill and right of La Mer.

content.description: Climb a steep face on pockets to pull over a lip and clip the anchors.
content.location: "Dusty looking lichen covered rock" to the right of Midsummer Night.

content.description: Start with some face climbing before pulling onto the arete.  Hang on near the top for the "monster holds" that keep the grade.
content.location: Climbs the face to the right of the mossy chute next to Buttercup.  Route is named for the ring of moss tot he right of the climb.

content.description: Climb the middle rock in the saddle of the alcove for a few bolts before stepping onto the adjacent face and finish the crux.  This line was the original line used to reach the top of the Sun Dragon Block and still has bolts beyond the anchor leading to the top of the formation.
content.location: Uphill of La Mer inside the alcove.

content.description: Climb a short face into a crux bulge.  After pulling the bulge continue for some more face climbing.
content.location: Starts right of the shallow cave and the seam. (Not recommended to climb onto the boulder above the route as it may not be secure)

content.description: Climb enjoyable pockets and edges to a wide arete with worsening holds towards the finish.
content.location: Uphill of a seam and a small cave.

content.description: Follow a technical for the grade face up the left of the arete. Continue into steep yellow rock and large jugs to finish at the anchors.
content.location: First route when entering the alcove from the Sun Dragon Block.  Follow the trail uphill and into the alcove.  La Mer lies on the arete to the low left buttress.

content.description: Climb the black streak of rock on thin edges for some technical moves top a short face.
content.location: Uphill at the top of the 1st Alcove, the left of the two routes in the top left corner.

content.description: Follow the yellow rock up some big holds that keep this route fun but interesting for the grade.
content.location: Right most route in the left uphill corner of the alcove.

content.description: The 1st Alcove is home to 12 or more sport climbs ranging from 5.9 to 5.11, including the classic La Mer, and Spindrift.
